Course Description: Combinatorial Optimization studies the structures and algorithms underlying discrete optimization problems. A central role in combinatorial optimization is played by polyhedral techniques, namely the representation of combinatorial problems as optimization problems over polyhedra or convex bodies and using the geometry to give insight into the combinatorial problems. The course will be a mix of basic and advanced topics in this area.

Course Outcomes.CO1: Students will be able to identify and apply basic algorithmic questions about convex sets
Course Outcomes.CO2: Students will be able to apply polyhedral results and algorithms for flows, matchings, arborecences, etc. to model combinatorial problems.
Course Outcomes.CO3: Students will be able to apply the ellipsoid algorithm to solve combinatorial optimization problems with exponentially many constraints
Course Outcomes.CO4: Students will be able to identify and model problems using matroids and submodular functions and use algorithms for problems on matroids and submodular functions.

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Background on Polyhedra, Linear Programming, Complementary Slackness.
Integer Programming: TUM, TDI, Cutting Planes, Lagrangean relaxation
Spanning Trees and Arboresences: Polyhedral results and packing spanning trees
Flows and Cuts: Goldberg-Tarjan, Gomory-Hu Trees, Min-cost flows

Resource Material.Textbook: Geometric Algorithms and Combinatorial Optimization, Groetschel, Lovasz, Schrijver
